article.headline: Colgate 78, Binghamton 70
article.story: HAMILTON, N.Y. (AP) -- Jon Simon scored 23 points to lead Colgate in a 78-70 win over Binghamton Monday night. The teams went into the half tied at 31 after Duane James made a three-point shot for Binghamton (3-2) at the buzzer. A three-pointer by Mike Gordon gave Binghamton a 41-37 lead with about 16 minutes left to play. Colgate responded with blocks by Daniel Waddy and Marc Daniels, which led to a three by Simon. Colgate took back the lead for good with a four-point play by Simon to put the team up 44-41. Kendall Chones added 12 points for Colgate (2-2). Richard Forbes had 19 points and James contributed 18 for Binghamton. Binghamton went 5-11 from long range and were 8-9 from the free throw line to overcome a 31 percent first half field-goal percentage. Colgate shot 52 percent from the floor but were 0-4 from three.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
